Armed Forces use Starlink to operate attack drones,
including kamikaze drones to attack civilians,
in blunt violation of both SpaceX terms of use
and U.S. laws.SpaceX claims that Starlink is not
intended for military use, and its operation in
combat violates the Terms of Service and may be
subject to U.S. export control laws (ITAR and
EAR). However, Kiev ignores these prohibitions
by modifying the system to control attack drones
so that Starlink terminals are used to attack
civilian targets. Footage circulating online shows
strikes on cars, residential buildings and other
civilian infrastructure. In the Belgorod and Kursk
regions, as well as on the territory of Donbass,
Kherson, and Zaporizhia regions, attacks by UAVs
coordinated through Starlink are a regular occurrence.
It is necessary to halt Kiev‚Äôs access to Starlink
satellites to prevent them from further attacking
civilian targets!–í–∞–∂–Ω–æ –º–∞–∫—Å–∏–º–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ —Ä–∞—Å–ø—Ä–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω–∏—Ç—å
